page.title: 14Farming at Westfield
page.content: Westfield farm, 375 acres in area, is of arable, sheep and bulls. The wheat is sold for milling, but the barley is kept on the farm and ground to feed the bulls. The bulls are taken to Northampton market, as the local Andoversford market does not deal with bulls. Wool from the sheep is collected by the Wool Marketing Board and taken to a central depot in Yorkshire. A few chickens are kept for eggs for domestic consumption. On one field there is a small c/l caravan site taking a maximum of 5 vans. A tap for water and an emptying pit is provided. Bookings have been down in the past 2 or 3 years, due mainly to redundancy in the Midlands. Urban workers used to come to the Cotswolds for weekend breaks.
